properties.title: The Seaside Museum
properties.notes: Hybrid? (Devolved 2015 - There is a history of museum collections in the town since 1932 and it appears that a museum was opened to the public in 1939. The museum moved to its current premises in 1996 (the year of foundation given in the domus data). The collections appear to be owned by the Herne Bay Historical Records Society and the museum was operated by this group until 1996. At this point it seems that the collections were loaned to Canterbury City Council who administered the museum (but there is also an indication that the Council own some of the collection). In 2015 the Herne Bay Museum Trust had their tender accepted by the Council to manage and operate the museum). Previously known as Herne Bay Museum and Gallery (changed in 2015)

properties.title: Norton Collection Museum
properties.notes: GOVERNANCE CHANGE. Independent Private museum from 1979-1992. Local authority museum from 1992-2008. Independent Not for Profit museum from 2016. Collection assembled by Dennis Norton and opened as a museum in 1979. Norton decided that best way to safeguard the museum was to transfer it to the local authority, which happened in 1992. Visitor numbers decreased and the local authority decided to close the museum in 2008. Lengthy negotiations took place between the Council and Norton and ultimately a trust was set up and the council agreed to sell the building and collections to the Trust. The museum re-opened in 2016. Previously known as Bromsgrove Museum.
